pullRequest.title: Update resolve code to support OpenJDK MH
pullRequest.bodyText:
Rename methodTypes table to invokeCache table
new sendResolveOpenJDKInvokeHandle
new resolveInvokeHandle
update resolveInvokeDynamic
update resolveVirtualMethodRefInto
update resolveStaticMethodRefInto
Modify Interpreter code to support the new single slot design
update old_slow_jitResolveHandleMethod

Related: #7352
Co-authored-by: Babneet Singh sbabneet@ca.ibm.com
Signed-off-by: Jack Lu Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com

nodes.bodyText:
Should it be an #elif instead of an #else in case both opt_openjdkMethodhandle and opt_methodHandle flags are disabled? Reference to the coding standard. If this change is accepted, then it should be applied to all ifdefs.
#if defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)
...
#elif defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) /* defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE) */
...
#else /* defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) */
    /* JSR292 completely disabled. */
    ASSERT if possible since this code shouldn't be executed when the flags are disabled;
#endif /* defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE) */
Correct the formatting for the multi-line comment, and add missing full-stops. Reference to the coding standard.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            sendResolveOpenJDKInvokeHandle(J9VMThread *currentThread, J9ConstantPool *ramCP, UDATA cpIndex, I_32 refKind, J9Class *resolvedClass, J9ROMNameAndSignature* nameAndSig)
          
          
            
            sendResolveOpenJDKInvokeHandle(J9VMThread *currentThread, J9ConstantPool *ramCP, UDATA cpIndex, I_32 refKind, J9Class *resolvedClass, J9ROMNameAndSignature *nameAndSig)
If I recollect correctly, new tracepoints should always be added to the end of file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -222,6 +222,13 @@ TraceExit=Trc_VM_resolveStaticFieldRef_Exit Overhead=1 Level=3 Template="resolve
 TraceEntry=Trc_VM_resolveInstanceFieldRef_Entry_old Obsolete Overhead=1 Level=3 Template="resolveInstanceFieldRef(ramCP=%p, cpIndex=%zu, flags=%zx, returnAddress=%p)"
 TraceExit=Trc_VM_resolveInstanceFieldRef_Exit Overhead=1 Level=3 Template="resolveInstanceFieldRef --> result=%d"
 
+TraceEntry=Trc_VM_resolveInvokeHandle_Entry Overhead=1 Level=3 Template="resolveInvokeHandle(ramCP=%p, cpIndex=%zu, flags=%zx)"

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            isMethodHandleINL(U_8* methodName, U_16 methodNameLength)
          
          
            
            isMethodHandleINL(U_8 *methodName, U_16 methodNameLength)
missing default. Coding standard: Switch statements should always include a default:.

This shouldn't be indented.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	#if defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)
          
          
            
            #if defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)

We should also disable the above VarHandle (VH) code since OpenJDK VHs are rewritten to the invokehandle bytecode and the above code won't be used.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            #endif /* defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) || defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE) */
          
          
            
            #else /* defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) */
          
          
            
                ASSERT(...);
          
          
            
            #endif /* defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE) */

Not needed since we are also disabling the else if for VarHandles since it is not needed for the OpenJDK implementation.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            #endif /* defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) */

Don't share this if statement between the two implementations since it makes code difficult to read:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            #elif defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) /* defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE) */
          
          
            
            #elif defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) /* defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE) */
          
          
            
            		if ((NULL != cpShapeDescription) && (resolvedClass == J9VMJAVALANGINVOKEMETHODHANDLE(vm))) {

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            #if defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)
          
          
            
            #if defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)
          
          
            
            		if ((NULL != cpShapeDescription) && (resolvedClass == J9VMJAVALANGINVOKEMETHODHANDLE(vm))) {

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            #if defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) || defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1368,18 +1444,46 @@ resolveVirtualMethodRefInto(J9VMThread *vmStruct, J9ConstantPool *ramCP, UDATA c
 			cpShapeDescription = J9ROMCLASS_CPSHAPEDESCRIPTION(cpClass->romClass);
 			lookupOptions |= J9_LOOK_CLCONSTRAINTS;
 		}
-		
-#if defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE)
-		/*
-		 * Check for MH.invoke and MH.invokeExact.
-		 *
-		 * Methodrefs corresponding to those methods already have their methodIndex set to index into
-		 * cpClass->methodTypes. We resolve them by calling into MethodType.fromMethodDescriptorString()
-		 * and storing the result into the cpClass->methodTypes table.
-		 */
+
+#if defined(J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE) || defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		) {
The entry tracepoint should be invoked before the above return statements. The exit tracepoint should also be invoked before the above return _statements.
if (result != NULL) is equivalent to the else block in the previous if/else block.
The entry tracepoint should be invoked before the above return statement. The exit tracepoint should also be invoked before the above return statement.
The code can be rewritten to have only one return statement. This will allow entry and exit tracepoints to be correctly located.
If possible, avoid multiple return statements. This will make it easier to position entry and exit tracepoints.

nodes.bodyText:
The extra brackets remove any ambiguity from the order of operations.  It's clear that the + is pointer arithmetic on J9RAMMethodRef*.  Otherwise you need to know which order of operations occurs first:  casting vs addition
My vote is keep them
the code on the old path used to handle resolving the targetClass here.  Is this not needed anymore?

Shouldn't this iterator be renamed given it's 1) not iterating MTs anymore, 2) it's now dealing with the invokeCache?
@amicic opinions?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -85,7 +85,11 @@ class GC_ClassIterator {
 		, _classStaticsIterator(env, clazz)
 		, _constantPoolObjectSlotIterator((J9JavaVM *)env->getLanguageVM(), clazz)
 		, _callSitesIterator(clazz)
+#if defined(J9VM_OPT_OPENJDK_METHODHANDLE)
+		, _methodTypesIterator(clazz->romClass->invokeCacheCount, clazz->invokeCache)

nodes.bodyText: Why both resolveInvokeHandle and sendResolveOpenJDKInvokeHandle?  If they are related, shouldn't the names both include OpenJDK?

Can you add a comment like this to the code?  It makes it clear what the data we're working with is
/* Fetch the method to call and add the "appendix" arg from the invokeCacheArray.
 * The stack transition looks like:
 * args  <- SP
 * MH
 *
 * and becomes:
 * invokeCacheArray[1] "appendix" <- SP
 * args
 * MH
 *
 * and sendMethod is ((j.l.MemberName)invokeCacheArray[0]).vmtargetOffset
 */
This should TrcAssert in the non OJDK MH case rather than return a nonsense (null) value

Should this be 15?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	*      - 16 bytes for the original method name ("linkToInterface" is the longest)
          
          
            
            	*      - 15 bytes for the original method name ("linkToInterface" is the longest)

Similar comment applies here as well about using DIRECT option.
Also, names like "modifiedX" should in some way, modify X.  Otherwise the code is confusing

VM_Assert_
But yes, totally agree!
JIT expects this helper to return the address of the entry, not the content of the entry. See the current implementation.

commit.message:
Rename methodTypes table to invokeCache table

Co-authored-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>

Update resolve code to support OpenJDK MH

- new sendResolveOpenJDKInvokeHandle
- new resolveOpenJDKInvokeHandle
- update resolveInvokeDynamic
- update resolveVirtualMethodRefInto
- update resolveStaticMethodRefInto

Co-authored-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>

Update BytecodeInterpreter to support OpenJDK MH

Modify Interpreter code to support the new single slot design

Co-authored-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>

- update old_slow_jitResolveHandleMethod
